intro: Linum medium, commonly known as common flax, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces blue or white flowers with five petals, which are arranged in a loose raceme. Its seeds are widely used for oil production and fiber extraction. Linum medium thrives in well-drained soils and is often cultivated for both agricultural and ornamental purposes.
